definition: to serve as/to be a substitute for
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Most had been taken in war.
sentences.chinese: 大部分都被充作士兵投入戰爭。

sentences.english: When you sleep in the open, old newspaper can serve as a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 在野外睡覺時，舊報紙可充作毛毯用。

sentences.english: That box served us as a table.
sentences.chinese: 那個箱子充作我們的桌子。

sentences.english: This enables some of these light Blacks to pass as whites.
sentences.chinese: 這使那些膚色淺淡的黑人可以充作白人。

sentences.english: There it is, all blood-stained, on the desk, as a testimony of the crime.
sentences.chinese: 血跡斑斑的，在那張桌子上，充作物證。

sentences.english: This episode may serve as a paradigm.
sentences.chinese: 這一插曲可以充作典型例子。

definition: to fill a post/to act as
to make up the number (i.e. to fill places up to a given number)/to serve as stopgap
to place in safe keeping/to leave sth with sb
able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
